pros: The families you work with are enjoyable. You truly get to see how an adoption can complete a family. Through international adoptions, it was extremely helpful working with the consultants for each country.
cons:
Bethany has a poor training program. I was thrown into the job with minimal training and basically had to teach myself how to do my job tasks. I would not know if I was missing something or doing something wrong until I was directly confronted with it. As with most non-profit agencies, the pay is low and the hours you are expected to work are not realistic when you're hired as a "part-time" employee. 

I was laid off due to budget issues and later hired for a contract position. If Bethany Christian Services offers contract work, do not accept the position. Despite putting many hours into interviewing families and completing home studies, I was not paid for the work I did as the agency hired a new manager who did not recognize my contract work.

review_title: Great for the community; not great to employees

They also fail to address issues of sexual harassment of employees by clients in an appropriate and effective manner.
